work.summary:
I spearheaded the development of internal tools and new interview prompts to benefit candidates and the team. 
 I also conducted technical screens of coding bootcamp applicants and assessed algorithmic aptitude in various languages, including JavaScript, Ruby, Python, and Java.

I refined the application’s existing technical design documentation, as well as the existing database schemas. 
 I also developed the user authentication and MVP features on the frontend using React and Redux utilizing API calls written with Flask and Marshmallow.

I conducted in-home technical assistance for more than 1,500 clients, while upselling additional products and service at a 75% percent rate. 
 Managed partnerships with companies such as Google, Apple, DJI, Magic Leap and Sonos. 
 And developed and facilitated training for new and existing employees to target growth opportunities, resulting in a 20-30% average increase in sales metrics.

I introduced a new form of “Value based” sales training for a team of 8 associates to drive team KPIs over the monthly goal by 20% while maintaining the highest customer rating in the region. 
 And generated the top individual sales metrics in the region for consecutive months, outpacing peers in revenue by over 45%.

projects.name: CloudSound
projects.description: community driven music streaming application inspired by soundcloud.com, where users can login to stream music or upload music of there own for free!
projects.stack: React, Redux, Rails 5, PostgreSQL and SASS

projects.name: Mastery
projects.description: mastery is a web application that allows users to master a skill of their choosing, track their progress, and share with friends!
projects.stack: React, Redux, Express.js, Node.js, MongoDB, Mongoose and SASS

projects.name: Taco Tuesday
projects.description: food themed matching game inspired by Lebron James, where the user has to match the ingredients of a customer's order.

education.description: highly selective full stack engineering program with a 3% acceptance rate.
pursued a bachelors in Software Engineering, with course work in computer science, algorithms, Java and Python
